title: TIF import issues upload wizard
body:
## Workaround
Use a CSV with links which was fixed in #925 
At the moment Tiff files are converted to images so tiff support is minimal
Example of working tif files:
https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/11sBY_dFCl4ww1Wn1YXQhbqeEL8_Snp_UAmHZqndrjRs/edit#gid=0

## Issue
Importing a `.tif` file from a URL works.
Importing from upload wizard does not seem to work.

There appear to be two maybe _different_ errors depending on using local files or connections

1) Local: Dropzone throws an error. 
Then when progressing to final step it shows 0 bytes and freezes.

2) Connections: (which avoids dropzone in theory),
it shows a false Success message. No actual inputs are created. 

The most recent change here was adding geotiff. When it's geotiff "Yes" it works.
I was not able to see anything super obvious that the recent geo addition is doing in the none geo case.
But it's still a little bit suspect, 

This is what's thrown when clicking next. (Vue drop zone event in top right) the `error` is not expected and does not appear in image case.

![vue drop zone error on tiff file](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/18080164/173971177-523aa60f-dd11-4222-96f8-b7aff0491261.png)

Another strange thing is this upload is trying to pass an object which looks wrong
(see request object%20 in bottom right)

![drop zone case](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/18080164/173971274-98f125f0-2726-4a07-baf6-817da8ff7f67.png)
